intro: Trichiogramme alismifolia, commonly known as the water fern, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its rhizomes are submerged, anchoring the plant while absorbing nutrients from the water. Trichiogramme alismifolia plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to aquatic organisms.
